decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures with abilities that disrupt opponents' strategies while building up devotion to blue for powerful effects from Thassa, God of the Sea and Master of Waves. The inclusion of Mutavault provides additional versatility and aggression. Rapid Hybridization and Tidebinder Mage also provide removal options to control the board. The objective is to overwhelm opponents with early aggression and evasive threats, while maintaining card advantage and tempo control through card draw and disruption effects.

The key focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck aims to stall the game with board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Detention Sphere while drawing cards with Sphinx's Revelation and Divination. Jace, Architect of Thought provides card advantage and Aetherling offers a win condition that is difficult to deal with. The deck also includes a few versatile removal spells like Azorius Charm and Last Breath to deal with threats. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a long game.

The main focus of this Esper Control deck is to establish and maintain control over the game through a combination of powerful removal spells, card draw, and counterspells. With a variety of answers to threats on the board, such as Detention Sphere and Supreme Verdict, alongside card advantage engines like Sphinx's Revelation and Jace, Architect of Thought, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent. By carefully managing resources and disrupting the opponent's game plan, Esper Control aims to control the pace of the game and ultimately secure victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures with a heavy devotion to black mana to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Cards like Pack Rat and Gray Merchant of Asphodel provide strong threats, while cards like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall help to control the opponent's board. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Dreadbore and Doom Blade to deal with any threats. The mana base allows for consistency in playing the powerful black creatures and spells, making it a formidable aggro deck in a standard 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle centered around red devotion. The key strategy involves utilizing creatures like Burning-Tree Emissary and Chandra's Phoenix to quickly build up devotion to red, allowing for powerful spells like Fanatic of Mogis and Stormbreath Dragon to deal significant damage. The inclusion of cards like Chandra, Pyromaster and Lightning Strike provide additional removal and direct damage options to maintain pressure on the opponent. With a strong mana base and versatile creatures, this deck aims to secure victory through efficient aggression.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive black creatures and spells that focus on building devotion to black. The strategy revolves around playing powerful cards such as Desecration Demon and Gray Merchant of Asphodel while disrupting the opponent with cards like Thoughtseize and Bile Blight. The deck also includes ways to draw additional cards and gain life to maintain pressure on the opponent.Overall, the deck aims to establish board control and quickly close out the game with heavy hitters.

The focus of this Naya Aggro deck is to quickly build up a powerful and resilient board presence by enchanting creatures with auras such as Ethereal Armor and Unflinching Courage. The deck also includes versatile removal and protection spells like Selesnya Charm and Boros Charm to help maintain control and pressure the opponent. With creatures like Voice of Resurgence and Witchstalker providing additional value and resilience, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win through early aggression and efficient combat tricks.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and gaining card advantage. This UW Control deck focuses on drawing cards, countering spells, and wiping the board with board wipes like Supreme Verdict. The win condition is usually by playing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, Architect of Thought and Elspeth, Sun's Champion, or by casting a large Sphinx's Revelation to gain card advantage and stabilize the game. Additionally, Aetherling provides a strong finisher to close out the game. The mana base is set up to support the color requirements of the spells in the deck.

The focus of this Esper Control deck is to play defensively and disrupt the opponent's strategy with a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. This deck aims to control the game by using cards like Supreme Verdict and Detention Sphere to keep the board clear, while also utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver to disrupt the opponent's hand and exile their key threats. The deck also includes card draw and lifegain with Sphinx's Revelation to help maintain resources and outlast the opponent in a prolonged game.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence and applying pressure on the opponent using efficient creatures with built-in protection and evasion. The deck also includes a variety of removal spells and versatile planeswalkers to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support a three-color strategy while ensuring consistent access to all the necessary colors for the spells in the deck. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful enchantments like Whip of Erebos and Spear of Heliod provides additional value and resilience to the deck's threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells like Supreme Verdict and Thoughtseize, as well as powerful planeswalkers like Jace, Architect of Thought and Elspeth, Sun's Champion. It also includes powerful finishers like Aetherling and Blood Baron of Vizkopa. The deck aims to control the board state, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and eventually win the game through card advantage and powerful threats. The mana base is optimized for casting spells of multiple colors, allowing for flexibility in game play.

This deck focuses on quickly dropping powerful creatures like Ghor-Clan Rampager, Polukranos, and Stormbreath Dragon to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Courser of Kruphix and Sylvan Caryatid for card advantage and mana ramp. Domri Rade and Xenagos, the Reveler provide additional creature support and card draw. Removal spells like Dreadbore and Mizzium Mortars help control the opponent's board. The mana base includes a mix of dual lands and creature lands for consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive creatures, backed up by powerful enchantments and utility spells. By leveraging cards like Master of Waves and Thassa, God of the Sea, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and control the tempo of the game. Using a combination of evasion, card advantage, and disruption, the deck seeks to outpace the opponent and secure a victory through relentless aggression and strategic decision-making.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful removal spells. By utilizing a combination of efficient creatures and disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall, it aims to control the game and maintain pressure on the opponent. Mutavault provides additional versatility and reach, while cards like Lifebane Zombie and Herald of Torment offer additional threats and evasion. The overall strategy is to establish a dominant board presence early on and capitalize on any openings to secure a victory.

The main focus of this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and take advantage of devotion to blue mana. By efficiently controlling the board with counterspells and removal spells, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and push for damage quickly. Thassa, God of the Sea provides additional card advantage and unblockable damage, while Master of Waves can generate a large army of elemental tokens. With a mix of evasive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to outpace opponents and close out the game before they can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using removal spells like Bile Blight, Devour Flesh, Hero's Downfall, and Mizzium Mortars to handle threats while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Slaughter Games. The deck also aims to establish a strong board presence with versatile creatures like Blood Baron of Vizkopa, Pack Rat, and Obzedat, Ghost Council. By utilizing cards like Underworld Connections and Read the Bones for card advantage, this Orzhov Control deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a 1 vs 1 format.
